content.prompt: Assume the government imposes a price floor above the current equilibrium price in the market for a good. Which of the following will occur?

choices.label: Since the price floor is set above the equilibrium price, nothing will change because the price floor is not binding.
There will be a shortage of the good.
Compared to the equilibrium price, there will be an increase in the quantity exchanged.
There will be an excess supply of the good.
At the quantity sold, the marginal cost of production will exceed the marginal benefit to consumers.

topic.text: 2.8: The Effects of Government Intervention in Markets

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
